body:
Comment 2: 
Wow, I was not able to find that, but now that I'm searching for things like "golang
example functions" and "golang writing examples" I can't help but notice testing is a
top result.  I must have written it off initially because I assumed they were false
positives for "example [testing] functions", not actual code examples.  (It probably
doesn't help that examples don't import package testing either.)

Perhaps a cross-reference from "Godoc: documenting Go code" would be good for improving
discoverability?  Something like "Godoc recognizes example code written according to
package testing's naming conventions and tries to present it appropriately."
